title: Windows 7 SP1 x86-x64 + Activator
description:
- Windows 7 SP1 x86-x64 DVD's plus Activator -

  + 32-bit : Starter, Home Basic, Home Premium, Professional, Ultimate +
  + 64-bit :          Home Basic, Home Premium, Professional, Ultimate +

by LtG18, my first torrent.
(The Activation and DVD/USB tool's are not my work but I did configure the ISO's).

Minimum 32-bit Requirements:
  1 GHz 32/64-bit Processor
  1 GiB RAM
  DirectX 9.0c graphics card (only for Aero)
  16 GB of hardrive storage

Minimum 64-bit Requirements:
  1 GHz 64-bit Processor
  2 GiB RAM
  DirectX 9.0c graphics card (only for Aero)
  20 GB of hardrive storage

Contents:
 - Windows 7 SP1 x86 (32-bit) ISO
 - Windows 7 SP1 x64 (64-bit) ISO
 - Windows 7 DVD/USB Tool

Instructions:
  1.a) Burn either 32/64 ISO depending on your needs.
  1.b) or install and use the Windows 7 DVD/USB to create a bootable USB drive to install Windows 7 from.
    ^!!WARNING: This will erase all files on the USB drive!!^ (Minimum of 4 GB drive is required)
  2.) Reconfigure your computer's BIOS and boot the DVD/USB and run the installation.
  3.) Select whether to upgrade or cleanly install your prefered OS version.
  4.) Complete the install and reconfigure your BIOS to boot from your hard drive.
  5.) After initial setup, locate the DVD/USB and run the "Windows 7 Activation" tool.
  6.) Restart your computer, and enjoy your newly installed Windows 7 OS.
 *7.) Locate your manufacturer's website for drivers and software for your model computer.
  
Precautions:
  1.) Ensure that there are downloadable driver's for Windows 7 for your computer BEFORE installing Windows 7.
  1.a) If you need internet access on the new OS and don't have a second computer with internet access,
         download the computer's LAN, ethernet, and/or WiFi drivers before the installation.
  1.b) Some, not all, newer computer's running Windows 8 do not have drivers for Windows 7.
  2.) Backup any data you wish to keep on your computer. Upgrades may or may not delete some data.
        Clean installs will erase all data.
  3.) When using a USB with the Win7 DVD/USB tool to install, backup any data from the USB before using it.
       (Minimum of 4 GB drive is required)
